Zombies, there are some scary parts as well.  This game is awesome even for today's standards.  Left 4 Dead offers hours of game play, achievements, and a game style that will have you and your friends screaming 'get him off'.  Left 4 Dead is a game I would recommend for anyone that has a few friends and are looking for a good shoot em' up co-op game.  I would recommend buying a 4 pack on sale if you are trying to play with friends, and a Valve Complete bundle if it's for yourself.  You'll get a lot of other wonderful games as well.

7.5/10 overall, and a 10/10 for zombie video games.

Left 4 Dead, one of MY personal favorites of all time, I played it on the xbox when it first came out back in 2008. It really was a milestone in FPS zombie shooters. It had characters that'd grow on you in a instant, a good setting, and good graphics at the time. I have had many good memories with this game. This is a MUST HAVE for any zombie buffs out there.

I may be the last person on earth to play L4D after seven years of its release, for the first time, but better late than never, right?! ;) You know a game has taken away your senses when that first smile on your face appears as soon as you click "Start Game". This is exactly what happened to me and I'm completely immersed, drenched and in love with L4D. Have fun shooting the Infected with your buddies and savour the joy of immersive gaming experience! And one more thing, "GO TO HELL WITCH"!

I've put quite of bit of time in this game on the xbox years ago. When I saw it on sale in steam, I had to get it for pc as well. I also bought a copy for my dad and he was an immediate fan. If you are a zombie shooter fan, this is a must own!

I may not have many hours logged on PC, but these two games are mostly responsible for my 8+ year relationship with my girlfriend. About 60% of those years were spent playing this gem on Xbox. Split screen. Without DLC. On an old box TV. The struggle was real.

Left 4 Dead is a throwback to the arcades of the 1980's, giving the gamer a taste of the frantic action of the original Street Fighter and Mortal Kombat insanity that arguably started it all.

The gameplay itself is nothing like these old games of course, but the spirit is very much the same. Fast action interspersed with moments to allow the players to collect themselves before the coming onslaught that is not unlike the round based mechanics of those earlier games.

They also have great simplicity in common; nothing is wasted and there is little to no attempt to create characters (though surprisingly character is something that oozes from the game). Instead the developers rely on sparse dialogue and good character design to convey each of the four characters unique flavours.

Unusually this game, though designed for up to four players, is just as much fun to play alone. The AI of the computer controlled characters seems fluid and they help out when needed with a logic that can easily be taken for another human player. In truth of course it is best to play with several friends, especially when chat is enabled, but single player functionality is wonderfully realised.

If you want a game that plays well as a single player, but is an unbeatable experience in multiplayer this game is a hard one to beat. Regardless of whether you are a seasoned gamer or casual player the controls are intuitive (allowing for both keyboard and controller support) and the learning curve is only dictated by the level of insanity you require.
Left 4 Dead is highly recommended.

Left 4 Dead... o que falar desse jogo??? bom para começar este é um jogo incrível, frenético, cooperativo... o gráfico não é seu forte, mas sua jogabilidade que é simples e responde muito bem, tem um arsenal de armas bem limitado infelizmente, porem tem diversos modos de jogo que deixa-o mais interessante... jogar sozinho é um pouco chato... melhor enjoa rápido, porém jogar com os amigos é muito bom... o uso de microfone faz com que melhore ainda mais a jogabilidade... para aquele que gostam de jogar com amigos é mais que obrigatório ter este jogo na lista... diversão garantida...
Se o preço não estiver bom, espere uma promoção... garato vale a pena...

[b]Rank:[/b] 8.5/10
[b]Recommendation(s):[/b] Play some other Valve game beforehand. Have a few friends who own a copy of Left 4 Dead 1. Look towards owning L4D2.
[b]Major Theme:[/b] Valve’s take on Zombies, proving a very good mix.
[b]Bought at Price:[/b] Valve Complete Pack

When Valve puts their hands into some area, they mean business. You can see that with the Zombie genre game Left 4 Dead 1 (L4D).

If you are looking for an original experience, look no further than No More Room in Hell, a source mod turned game available on Steam. If however you want a solid, tried and tested coop experience, look no further.

Once you start playing Left 4 Dead 2, you will see how simple this game is, and how much more it could have been. There was quite uproar when the features in L4D2 were to be in this title, but the splitting of feature sets does make sense in some regards. L4D has 2 tiers of weapons, limiting options for weapons, and combine that with fairly simple mechanics. Keep in mind that the AI director which controls placement of items, and which map variation to use, does change gameplay up. I wouldn’t go to say you won’t see the same play through again, but it does mix things up from time to time.

The gameplay is designed to mimic a zombie movie in many regards, but the coop side of it is one of the best I’ve ever played. It’s not to be taken lightly when I say that, as I really do mean it. Singleplayer is no more than you, and 3 AI followers going through somewhat randomized campaigns. Multiplayer is basically the same thing, but each person is able to do their own thing. 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=392589277

Issues include:
[list]
    [*]Feels as if simple mechanics are too simple
    [*]Improvements made in L4D2 should have been put in this title?
[*]Low amount of variance of mechanics and items
 [/list]

Positives include:
[list]
    [*]Can be played in Big Picture mode with a controller
    [*]Simple and easy game to master
    [*]Seamless integration between Singleplayer and Multiplayer
    [*]AI work well
[*]A good LAN party title
[*]Works well on older, but fairly recent systems
[/list]

I feel that this game is better than the sequel, sure the sequal adds a lot of features, but this game has better campains and the more fair Special infected, also ragdoll player death. And of course, most importantly, the better community that doesn't vote kick you as much.

Sadly, since all of the campaigns have been ported to the sequel (and I guess for good reason... since there are a couple improvements), valve doesn't bother supporting this game (There is no Linux version sadly, yet it's still at it's enormous price of 20bux) and there's only about a couple people playing the game, still though, they're nice veterans of the game who won't votekick you, unlike L4D2 where most of the players are ass damaged "pros" who will kick you for the stupidest of reasons, or no reason at all.

Is it worth buying? It's a great game, but since the community is pretty sparse now, you might want to get it on sale, instead of the 20bux valve wants you to spend still to this day.
